result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Fosnot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:06 am.  Defendant Matthew L Fosnot in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness (Deputy M. Schultz).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Witness excused.  Closing arguments.  Probable cause found.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed, reading waived.  Atty Riek requested to orally request substitution.  Court granted request.  Substitution to be filed today.
